bookCover.coverDescription: An interactive book on "Geometry" for grade-3

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A point has no length, no breadth, and no height.

Example:

A and B are points

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A line is made up of infinite points. A line does not have end points.

Example:

AB or BA is a line

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A line segment is a part of line. A line segment has two end points.

Example:

AB or BA is a line segment

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A ray has no endpoint with an arrow head in one direction.

Example:

AB is a ray

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
We use a ruler to measure length of a line segment.

Zero of ruler must coincide with the initial point of a line segment.


Example:

AB is 13 cm

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanation:
 
A line is made up of many points on a straight path.
A line segment is part of a line.
A ray has no endpoint with an arrow head in one direction.
 
A line segment has 2 end points. 
So, the answer is line segment.

line = *no end points*

line segment = *2 end points*

ray = *start point and arrow head*

dot = *no length, breadth, height*

params.text:
If two line segments meet at a common point, figure so formed is called an angle.

An angle is an open figure. It has one vertex and two arms.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The line segments AB and BC meet at the point B. Angle so formed is ABC.

The symbol of angle is ∡

We Say : Angle ABC
We Write : ∡ ABC

params.text:
A triangle is a closed plane figure with three sides and three vertices.

The symbol of a triangle is Δ.

Example:

ΔABC

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Step -1 : 

Draw 3 points A,B and C.

Step -2:

Join the 3 points with the help of a ruler.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A quadrilateral is a closed plane figure with four sides and four vertices.

The symbol of a quadrilateral is ▭

Example:

▭ABCD

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Step -1 :

Draw the four points A, B, C and D.

Step -2 :

Join all the points with the help of a ruler.

params.text:
Solid figures are 3D figures that have length, width, and height.

Some solid figures are:

1. Cube

2. Cuboid

3. Cylinder

4. Cone

5. Sphere

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A cube is a solid figure having equal sides.

Properties of a cube are:
Faces = 6
Vertices = 8
Edges = 12

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
A cuboid is a solid figure having :
Faces = 6
Corners = 8
Edges = 12

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: A cone is a geometric shape that's 3-dimensional and has a circular base that narrows to a point at the other end.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: Sphere is a round solid figure, or its surface, with every point on its surface equidistant from its centre.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text: It is a solid object which is closed by two equal circles at two ends and has a curved surface.

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
The sum of the sides of rectilinear figure is called perimeter.

Perimeter of triangles,rectangles, square, and quadrilateral bounded by line segments can be measured.

Example:

Perimeter of rectangle is:

= 1m + 2m + 1m + 2m

= 6m

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Perimeter of triangle ABC:

= AB + BC + CA

= 2cm + 3cm + 2cm

=7cm

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.textField:
Perimeter of the closed surface ABCD is:

= AD + DC + BC + AB
= 2 cm + 3 cm + *5 cm* + 3 cm
= *13c m*

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanation:
 
A cylinder is a solid object with 2 faces at bottom and top and curved surface along the two faces.
From the figure above, it is clear that the solid figure is a cylinder.
So, the answer is cylinder

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
Explanation:
 
Perimter of closed surface is:
= 2cm + 3cm + 2cm + 3cm
=10cm
 
Hence, the perimter of the rectangle is 10cm
